resources.shaders

Class Shader

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.shaders.Shader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlinnPhongShader, EnvironmentShader, FxaaShader, GammaCorrectionShader, GrayscaleShader, InvertShader, ReinhardToneMappingShader, ShadowShader, SkyBoxShader, SolidColorShader, TexturedQuadShader

    public abstract class Shader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Resource
    This abstract class is the base all of the shaders. It loads the shaders' source, creates the shader program, binds the attribute arrays and loads the uniform variables.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Shader stage.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shader

        public Shader(@NotNull
              java.lang.String vertexFile,
              @NotNull
              java.lang.String fragmentFile,
              @Nullable
              java.lang.String geometryFile,
              @Nullable
              java.lang.String tessControlFil,
              @Nullable
              java.lang.String tessEvaluationFile)
        It creates the shader program and stores the ids of the uniform variables.
        Parameters:
        vertexFile - relative path of the vertex shader's source (with extension like "res/shaders/myShader.glsl")
        fragmentFile - relative path of the fragment shader's source (with extension like "res/shaders/myShader.glsl")
        geometryFile - relative path of the geometry shader's source (with extension like "res/shaders/myShader.glsl")
        tessControlFil - relative path of the tessellation control shader's source (with extension like "res/shaders/myShader.glsl")
        tessEvaluationFile - relative path of the tessellation evaluation shader's source (with extension like "res/shaders/myShader.glsl")

      • connectUniform

        protected void connectUniform(@NotNull
                              java.lang.String uniformName)
        Stores the specified uniform variable's id in a list and after that you can load values to this connected uniform.
        Parameters:
        uniformName - uniform variable
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the specified uniform variable doesn't exist

      • getUniformId

        protected int getUniformId(@NotNull
                           java.lang.String uniformName)
        Returns the specified uniform variable's id.
        Parameters:
        uniformName - uniform variable
        Returns:
        uniform variable's id
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the specified uniform variable doesn't exist

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the shader. You have to start a shader before load uniform variables or render objects.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the shader. When a shader isn't running, you can't load uniform variables or render objects.

      • release

        public void release()
        Removes the shader program from the GPU's memory. After this method call you can't use this shader.
        Specified by:
        release in interface Resource

      • isUsable

        public boolean isUsable()
        Determines wheter this shader program is usable. If it returns false, you can't use if for anything.
        Specified by:
        isUsable in interface Resource
        Returns:
        true if usable, false otherwise

      • loadShader

        private static int loadShader(@Nullable
                              java.lang.String shaderFilePath,
                              @NotNull
                              Shader.ShaderStage stage)
        Loads a shader's source from the given path, creates the shader based on the given type and returns the shader's id.
        Parameters:
        shaderFilePath - relative path of the shader's source (with extension like "res/shaders/myShader.glsl")
        stage - shader's stage
        Returns:
        shader's id
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the shader's compilation failed
